author: jon
msg: check for null values

author: jon
msg: > * IMPLEMENTATION NOTE: If we can't serialize the object stored in
>      * the session, then check to see if it implements
>      * HttpSessionBindingListener and then call its
>      * valueUnbound method, allowing it to save its state
>      * correctly instead of just being lost into the etherworld

author: costin
msg: Use the simple pool inside jasper, to prevent GC for PageContext, JspWriter and
the buffer used by writer.
More objects can be recycled, this is just a start ( and it seems to have a significant
impact ).

author: costin
msg: Added a SimplePool object to be used in adapters and jsp.
It's using [] instead of Vector and has minimal code inside -
it will return null if empty and do nothing on overflow.
Note that using per/thread data is probably faster ( no
synchronize).

author: costin
msg: - Added "final" to all facades.
- group related functions in RequestImpl
- changed the interface to get "who set this session id" to getSessionIdSource()
( it's also more extensible than having isSessionIdFromURL, etc )
- removed unused/duplicated code in RequestImpl.getSession(). The session module is
handling sessions
- fixed ServletWrapper handling of .jsp files - the cleanup adds 10-20% in speed and
it's cleaner ( IMO ). I'll do a bit more cleanup and document what remains.
